712345f-a.text:
36th Street, Broadway to 6th Avenue.(Before Reconstruction)
President Borough of Manhatten.
L N IMPERATIVE.  December 7, 1919.

709442f-a.text:
Sixth Avenue, east side, from but not including 36th Street to
and including 37th Street.
June, 1925.

709438f-a.text:
Sixth Avenue, west side, north from West 35th to 36th St's., showing the easterly side of the triangular Herald Building. Occupants at this date include Rogers, Peet & Co. The northerly portion will shortly be razed for a modern office structure. The apex will remain until the Spring of 1940, when it will in turn be demolished. 1939 saw the demolishment of the Sixth Ave. "El" whose shadow appears at the right.

May 15, 1925

P. L. Sperr

709440f-a.text:
Sixth Avenue (across foreground),and vicinity,east side, from W. 35th (right) to 36th (left) Streets, as viewed northeastward from Macy's Department Store. This area, a part of the former "Satans Circus" is now a portion of Manhattan vast garment center and contains numerous loft and factory structures. Note Keen 's Chop House still remaining on the south side of 36th Street, to the east of the Avenue. In the background, dominating the skyline, is the office building, "No. 10 East
4Oth Street".
Februarv 5, 1929.
P.L. Sperr

709443f-a.text:
Greenwich Savings Bank, N.W. corner, Sixth Avenue and 36th Street.
February 20, 1930.
P.L.Sperr, Photographer.

709441f-b.text:
(1)
Sixth Ave., east side, north from, but not including West 35th Street. Also seen is the Sixth Ave. Elevated Line.
November 21, 1932.
L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing a view farther north. On the background can be seen the 38th Street station of the elevated line.
May 31. 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same, as seen from Wast 36th Street.
MaY S1, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
